comments.body: And the head should emit a redstone signal when looked at! (see my Vision Detector post)

When you say friendly structures, does that mean they can't be a little creepy or tricky to check out? Some of the best structures are more difficult to check out than others. Do you mean that they just aren't centered around a monster, or that they have to be completely passive?

Actually, I should have added that to my post. The answer is that I want more structures that aren't focused on monsters. A little difficulty is completely fine, but it should be more like a desert temple's TNT trap, or the arrow trap in a jungle temple, more functional mechanisms than monsters. thanks for the comment!

i think there should be a different type of "structure", which doesnt do much except add depth. maybe a desert pyramid but its just /\ and nothing else, or random trenches and dirt with cobwebs and tnt looking explosions
And then there should be a ruin version of such a structure generated in the swamp biomes.

It would be interesting if you could use it with other materials. 

Like making stone bricks with resin in the gaps.
But that would ruin the ENTIRE aspect and theme of the biome.
I don't think there should be pale villagers, but I'm all for making it so abandoned villages can spawn in the Pale Gardens.

yes, pale ABANDONED villages. no zombie villagers tho, just empty and creepy. there would also have to be dark oak villages to make this work, and also the abandoned villages should be made of pale wood and be very common to fit the vibe of the garden. they would also have to make the garden bigger, so that its not just a pale village and a few trees.
There should also be some good loot in abandoned pale garden villages.

As far as I'm aware, this functionality would involve storing more information in the block, making it unpushable by Java pistons (similar to beehives). Because you can still piston-push the logs above and below it to turn it off or on, I think it's worthwhile.

Could you explain what amplified world terrain is? A large part of the community is newer to the game (including me, I just have vague memories of the original nether), so a large part of the community won't understand this post.

Warning: I may not know what I'm talking about.
It's still present in the game right???
Alright that makes sense now. I voted.
I'll vote for this. Also, it might make more sense if you changed the title to amplified world settings in bedrock. At the moment, it will confuse some people as it's already a world setting in Java.
I really like the hallucinations idea! But maybe you should use shears instead of scissors. Scissors just seem too modern for Minecraft, which is supposed to be set in a pre-modern time period.
While I do like the hallucination concept, I think being able to choose which mob it is would be really hard to code.

Before the Pale Gardens was added to Minecraft, I really wanted a biome like it and I thought it would be cool if the player could be effected with blindness. Maybe these flowers could give the player at least a 1-8 minutes of blindness. I think this would be way better than hallucinations.
I like the idea of black berries but I don't like the effect.

Same for me. Black berries: good, effect: bad.

I do think the black berries would give a cool contrast with the white of the Pale Garden.
Yes absolutely, if MoJang wants this biome to be scary, they have to make it so players can't just find a loophole.
This would also be off-putting to players not in the know if they do try to burn it down, or even waste their time until the creakin comes!

I like this from a visual aesthetic point of view. Having a type of wood and leaves that can be perpetually burning could make for some interesting environments, such as a perpetual forest fire. This would add to the atmosphere, in addition to the game balance benefits you listed.
YES ITS PERFECT I NEED IT
God I wish it were real, google AI handed me this as the crafting recipe ;(
I absolutely agree with you.

yo creo que seria buena idea pero de otra forma que cuando este lloviendo y haga sol que aparesca un arcoiria

I think it would be a good idea but in a different way, so that when it is raining and sunny a rainbow appears.

Ī kotoda to omoukedo, ame ga futte iru toki to harete iru toki to wa chigau imi de, niji ga deru no wa
Por favor, agregue más información, sería muy apreciado. Si dijera eso mal, lo siento, hablo inglés y puede que no sea el mejor traduciendo... gracias!
I think this is a great idea since I like Minecraft Slimes.
These should be the alternative to slimes in slime chunks under pale gardens.

What does this mob drop when you defeat it? Resin Slimeballs and XP orbs? I think resin slimeballs also should be craftable with resin clump and normal slimeballs. Including the resin slimeballs can be craft into a new type of slime block called resin slime block.
Please vote for the resin slime :)
I agree. If there is no Creaking Heart in the biome, why bother at all? If there is a little more certainty that at night you will find a Creaking, it would add to the suspense of the Pale Garden.
Pls, make mojang see this idea

I also made a post about something similar called Vision Detecter. My idea was that when crafted with amethyst you get the calibrated vision detector which can sense players looking at it through walls.
Its also a cool idea how should it work but i think that the creaking has to have any application.
The entire point of armor is that it helps you take less damage. It wouldn't make sense if something you worked hard for hurt you.
i think that it should just deal more damage to anyone
This is a really cool idea, and also just good game design to make the player decide whether to risk high damage from the creaking or high damage from other threats.
I think that they shouldn't have put in the creaking in the first place, but now that it's in, let's not change it.

This is an awesome idea, since the ominous bottles have no effect other than raids and ominous trials (and flex points, if you wish). Perhaps it increases the likelihood of thunderstorms (since those happen so infrequently)?

It should increase mob spawn rate that have better armor and better enchantments, zombie siege should always trigger when nighttime (or only on full moon, because the raids could never be able to trigger at night with this).
Maple sap could perhaps be drunk like honey
a good idea
Um... You can't drink honey in Minecraft. (And hopefully not in real-life either). but maybe you could use it as a replacement for sugar in some recipes, like cake, and pumpkin pie.

1. You can drink honey in Minecraft using a bottle

2. The sap could make a new redstone component: The Sap Block! This block would combine features of the honey and slime block in new ways as per reds toner's request so it could help make all kinds of new contraptions!

3. The Sap Block could also be useful for building and stopping fall damage!

It's true as one commenter stated, that the pale garden and Creaking don't fit into the broader Minecraft worlds ecosystem, it's true that it's supposed to feel unnatural. But it has a detailed ecosystem in itself, more detailed in fact than most (or all) other biomes. This biome has trees that summon a Creaking (which I assume is an extension of the tree), the Creaking interacts with its tree, sending and receiving signals from the heart (that's the particle effect). The heart is made of resin, and when it receives strange signals from the Creaking (e.i., the player hits the Creaking), it grows more resin as if trying to reproduce itself in case of death (its not vary successful as the player takes the resin but whatever). Then there's the eyeblossoms, which communicate with each other, encouraging each other to open up. And of course lets not forget that day time mobs can't spawn in there, hinting at its hostility, the eyeblossoms poison bees so its safe too assume that the reason normal mobs don't spawn there is because the grass and moss poisoned and killed them. If anything this biome has a huge inner ecosystem compared too other biomes.
Could definitely be easier to make a recipe for with resin now.
these are all great ideas, and i think the third one should be if you are at two hearts or below, you gain invisibility, but other than that, great idea!
I like the first one best, it could be on helmets and be called “Hearing” or something.
I like this idea, but the name "crackerler" seems a bit off, especially given that it suggests a food theme.
I personally enjoy the idea of three biomes. If they were to add another, maybe it'd be the in-between dimension where the endermites exist?
Yeah, that seems good.
Or instead of adding a new item, just let people make blindness potions with the eye blossom instead of suspicious stew.
Nice!
This would make him kind of goofy and less creepy.
Maybe if they kinda freeze up and make a wood-creaking sound when you look at them, their eyes could also close too.
